Package gov.fnal.ppd.dd.util

Fermilab's Dynamic Displays System -- Various helper and utility classes that support other parts of the system.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DisplayCardActivator
    An interface to allow a details class to tell a high-level class to activate a specific display card.
    DisplayKeeper
    An interface to allow a details class to tell a high-level class when a display is alive (breaking a circular dependency)
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CheckDisplayStatus
    Utility class for the main Channel Selector class.
    DisplayButtonGroup
    A simple implementation of a button group, assuming buttons of type DDButton, which shows buttons as selected for a specific Display
    DisplayColorSliderUI
    Implement a JSlider.
    HSBColor
    Generate a set of colors that are (in theory) as distinct as possible from each other.
    JLabelCenter
    Helper class for building the Splash Screen for the channel selector.
    JLabelFooter
    A single-purpose instance of JLabel to show the status of the Display at the bottom of the ChannelSelector screen Adjusts the text within the label to fit in the provided space.
    JTextAreaBottom
    A simple extension to the JTextArea class which tried to have the bottom of the area visible at all times.
    SelectorInstructions
    Extend a JLabel to give the user some basic guidance on the use of the full-screen App.
    SimpleMouseListener
    A listener to attach to a Component to help the caller select a JCardLayout card when clicked.
    SplashScreens
    Utility class for ChannelSelector to deal with the splash screens on the touch-panel displays
    Util
    Some general utilities in the DD system
    WhoIsInChatRoom  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DatabaseNotVisibleException
    Specific exception that is thrown when one cannot contact the remote Dynamic Displays database.

Package gov.fnal.ppd.dd.util Description

Fermilab's Dynamic Displays System -- Various helper and utility classes that support other parts of the system. This is a "catch-all" package.
